DataElement.preferredDefinition: Group or classification to represent imaging results that use radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Transverse Spin Relaxation Time Change
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._The time it takes for the net nuclear spin in the plane that is perpendicular to the magnetic field of a spectrometer to decay to zero._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method of preparation for stem cell transplant that uses less than standard doses of chemotherapy and radiation prior to the transfer of stem cells, with the goal of providing protection against graft vs. host disease, while simultaneously minimizing the toxic effects of the conditioning treatment.

Concepts.definition: A method of preparation for stem cell transplant that uses less than standard doses of chemotherapy and radiation prior to the transfer of stem cells, with the goal of providing protection against graft vs. host disease, while simultaneously minimizing the toxic effects of the conditioning treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

Concepts.definition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.
The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.
